PRODUCER / SHIPPER DETAILS - Below noted we will inform our nominated forwarder

Prisma S.r.l.
Via dell’Industria, 4
31020 San Polo di Piave (TV), Italy
TAX ID / VAT: IT01636190264
Phone: +39 0422 8021
Email: info@prismaitalia.com <mailto:info@prismaitalia.com> 

 

CUSTOMS FORMALITIES – Below noted we will inform our nominated forwarder 

We handle customs clearance internally. Therefore:

We will issue and provide our customs declaration document (EX). 

Your freight forwarder must use our customs bill when exporting the goods.

To proceed correctly, we need you to confirm:
a) Port of loading (departure port)
b) Port of discharge (destination port)

 

DOCUMENTATION

We will send you the draft commercial invoice and final packing list by Monday – Please share for us to review, we will come incase of any clarification & revisions required.
Each line item will include:

*	HS Code (we will use 8418.91.00.00, in line with the actual product classification) / Country of Origin / Description / Quantity, unit price, total value / Incoterms (EXW San Polo di Piave) / Dimensions and weight

Please also confirm whether you require:

*	A Certificate of Origin – COO not required.
*	A legalized or stamped invoice – Stamped and signed invoice is sufficient, please handover originals to the forwarder when collecting goods 

 

Total cargo will be shipped in two containers, due to the volume. Please advise if you prefer:

*	A Certificate of Origin – COO not required.
*	A legalized or stamped invoice – Stamped and signed invoice is sufficient, please handover originals to the forwarder when collecting goods 

 

Total cargo will be shipped in two containers, due to the volume. Please advise if you prefer:

*	One single commercial invoice covering both containers, or  
*	Two separate invoices, in case you prefer to split documentation in the event of customs checks or cargo delays.

- we would like to request if we can receive the commercial invoice & packing list against each container loading, to easily identify the items in each container based on the documents on hand, please do let us know the complete cargo details and the type & no of containers required to arrange for loading. 

 

Please note that the goods are non-hazardous – the wine display cabinets do not contain any gas. No special delivery or handling instructions are required. Packaging will be solid and carried out in sturdy wooden crates, ensuring full protection during transport – Noted, please do share the pictures of the packed cargo before & after loading on the container, also would like to ensure the cargo is secured properly to avoid any shifts while the shipment is in transit

Please note that the goods are non-hazardous – the wine display cabinets do not contain any gas. No special delivery or handling instructions are required. Packaging will be solid and carried out in sturdy wooden crates, ensuring full protection during transport – Noted, please do share the pictures of the packed cargo before & after loading on the container, also would like to ensure the cargo is secured properly to avoid any shifts while the shipment is in transit  

We suggest using Venice port as the port of loading, given its proximity to our facility and its efficiency; most shipping lines departing from Venice route through Suez. As an alternative, Trieste port may also be considered. – thank you for the suggestion, however we will check with our forwarder, as this also depends on the shipping line as well 

 

We are still waiting to receive full billing details (company name, VAT number, registered address, and billing country). Kindly share those as soon as possible so we can issue the draft invoice accordingly – I have already shared the address below that must be mentioned on the commercial invoice, for billing purpose @Yasir Panthakkal <mailto:yasir.panthakkal@etoilegroup.com>  to advise. 

 

Hope to receive all the details today, so we can arrange the space & book the shipment with shipping line in timely manner prior summer break.

 

Thank you for your usual support.

 

Regards

Thanks for the follow-up.

Just to clarify, the terms previously discussed between our Commercial Director Zeno and Mr Das were based on a product price plus FOB shipment costs (billed separately).

 

That said, considering the upcoming summer shutdown of our company (from August 4th to 26th), we would actually suggest going for EXW terms instead. Hi Geeta, 

 

Thank you for your detailed message. Please find below our feedback and initial information, in view of organizing the shipment efficiently.

Given the upcoming summer holiday closure in Italy (our company will be closed from August 4th to August 26th, inclusive), we suggest managing the shipment under EXW (Ex Works) terms, so that your appointed forwarder can arrange transportation according to your preferred schedule. Goods will be ready for pickup from July 28th to August 1st, or starting again from August 27th.

 

PRODUCER / SHIPPER DETAILS

Prisma S.r.l.
Via dell’Industria, 4
31020 San Polo di Piave (TV), Italy
TAX ID / VAT: IT01636190264
Phone: +39 0422 8021
Email: info@prismaitalia.com <mailto:info@prismaitalia.com> 

 

CUSTOMS FORMALITIES

We handle customs clearance internally. Therefore:

We will issue and provide our customs declaration document (EX).

Your freight forwarder must use our customs bill when exporting the goods.

To proceed correctly, we need you to confirm:
a) Port of loading (departure port)
b) Port of discharge (destination port)

 

DOCUMENTATION

We will send you the draft commercial invoice and final packing list by Monday.
Each line item will include:

To proceed correctly, we need you to confirm:
a) Port of loading (departure port)
b) Port of discharge (destination port)

 

DOCUMENTATION

We will send you the draft commercial invoice and final packing list by Monday.
Each line item will include:

*	HS Code (we will use 8418.91.00.00, in line with the actual product classification) / Country of Origin / Description / Quantity, unit price, total value / Incoterms (EXW San Polo di Piave) / Dimensions and weight

Please also confirm whether you require:

*	A Certificate of Origin
*	A legalized or stamped invoice

 

Total cargo will be shipped in two containers, due to the volume. Please advise if you prefer:

*	One single commercial invoice covering both containers, or
*	Two separate invoices, in case you prefer to split documentation in the event of customs checks or cargo delays.

 

Please note that the goods are non-hazardous – the wine display cabinets do not contain any gas. No special delivery or handling instructions are required. Packaging will be solid and carried out in sturdy wooden crates, ensuring full protection during transport.

We suggest using Venice port as the port of loading, given its proximity to our facility and its efficiency; most shipping lines departing from Venice route through Suez. As an alternative, Trieste port may also be considered.

 

We are still waiting to receive full billing details (company name, VAT number, registered address, and billing country). Kindly share those as soon as possible so we can issue the draft invoice accordingly.

 

Kind regards,

 

Steven Cattai Paladin
